top_comments.comment: This might not be a design mistake but people often setting up two-way switches that operate room lights as you enter the room as well as can be switched off when in bed.

I am totally going to look for a nice rug for my bedroom! I am never going to have more pillows on my bed than needed - maybe that's very european of me.
But i do want my space to feel a bit more cozy!
If I have my labradoodle lie on my bed that adds texture, right?

comments_since_last_sample.body: From the "Oh, sweetie, no." to the creepy doll trapped in the mountain of chintz, I love it.

Until recently we've always stored things under our queen size bed - mostly out of season clothing, and clothing that no longer fit but that I couldn't bring myself to get rid of. Several months ago we got a new queen bed frame. This time it's goodbye dust ruffle/bedskirt hiding who-knows-what under the bed, and hello mid-century modern with the bedspread neatly tucked in around the mattress and the wood legs showing - goodbye years of unworn clothes hiding under the bed. I cannot tell you how freeing this was, to get rid of the literal crap under the bed. The few out of season clothing items I kept are easily stored in my closet. The clothes that didn't fit and never were going to fit again were donated to a thrift store, and are no longer taunting me. It's been a breath of fresh air to get rid of all that stuff. The new bed frame has a lower profile, and we don't need a box spring with it, and now the room looks so much bigger. The only down side is our cats had to find new places to hide.
